newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Wednesday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
Turnover rose to 3.007 billion yuan from 2.954 billion yuan with the seven-day contract the most actively traded.
Trading was active with non-banking financial institutions including securities houses borrowing heavily on the interbank market, traders said.
The active domestic A share markets was a positive factor boosting fund demand, traders said.
They said the rates were likely to move in a narrow range in the next few days.
In the mid-term, the interbank rates will also remain stable with the possibility of a cut in bank deposit rates becoming smaller and smaller, they added.
